Activity: Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and check emails for urgent requests or updates. Briefly browse Reddit for some interesting news.

Review the goal plan for the week: 'Continue defining initial data quality metrics for EHR data related to influenza tracking' and 'Set weekly targets for improvement'. Begin brainstorming potential data quality metrics.

Research existing literature and industry best practices for data quality metrics in healthcare, specifically related to influenza tracking. Focus on metrics like completeness, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness.

Document initial data quality metrics ideas and prepare a draft list. Examples include: Percentage of patients with complete vaccination records, accuracy of ICD-10 codes for influenza diagnoses, and consistency of reporting across different departments.
Email @da-1 to discuss the proposed data quality metrics and solicit feedback. Schedule a brief meeting for tomorrow to discuss in detail.
Start outlining a methodology for measuring the chosen data quality metrics. Consider data sources, tools (e.g., SQL queries, data analysis software), and reporting frequency.
Lunch break. Head to the cafeteria for a quick bite and catch up on sports news.
Continue refining the methodology for measuring data quality metrics. Focus on creating clear, actionable steps for data extraction, analysis, and reporting.
Begin drafting SQL queries to extract relevant data fields from the EHR database. Consult with @dba-1 to ensure efficient query design and access to necessary tables.
Test the SQL queries on a sample dataset to verify their accuracy and efficiency. Troubleshoot any errors or unexpected results.
Document the SQL queries and their purpose for future reference. Update the data quality metrics document with the finalized methodology.
Review progress made today and plan for tomorrow. Respond to any pending emails.
